intro: Linaria nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Linaria nevadensis is generally low-growing, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
